1.name: The Bad and the Beautiful
1.description: An unscrupulous movie producer uses an actress, a director and a writer to achieve success.

2.name: Singin' in the Rain
2.description: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

3.name: High Noon
3.description: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon when the gang leader, an outlaw he sent up years ago, arrives on the noon train.

4.name: Pony Soldier
4.description: In 1876, a Canadian North West Mounted Police Constable must obtain the release of white hostages captured by the Cree tribes that are raiding Montana from their Canadian reservation.

5.name: The Greatest Show on Earth
5.description: The dramatic lives of trapeze artists, a clown, and an elephant trainer are told against a background of circus spectacle.

6.name: The Quiet Man
6.description: A retired American boxer returns to the village of his birth in Ireland, where he finds love.

7.name: Ikiru
7.description: A bureaucrat tries to find a meaning in his life after he discovers he has terminal cancer.

8.name: Affair in Trinidad
8.description: Nightclub singer and her brother-in-law try to find her husband's killer.

9.name: The Floating Dutchman
9.description: In England, two men working on the docks close to London's Tower Bridge find a dead body of an unidentified man floating in the River Thames, they call the local police. The police later ...                See full summary »

10.name: Brandy for the Parson
10.description: A young couple get involved with a smuggler.

11.name: Moulin Rouge
11.description: Fictional account of French artist Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec.

12.name: Gift Horse
12.description: In 1940, the Captain of an old Royal Navy destroyer struggles with his crew, as well as the Nazis.

13.name: Road to Bali
13.description: Two unemployed show-biz pals accept treasure-diving work in Bali for a local princess and they find treasure, love and trouble.

14.name: The Big Sky
14.description: The success of the journey focuses on keeping the Indian girl alive as well as themselves to complete trade with the Blackfeet.

15.name: The Big Trees
15.description: A Quaker colony tries to save the giant sequoias from a timber baron.

16.name: Limelight
16.description: A fading comedian and a suicidally despondent ballet dancer must look to each other to find purpose and hope in their lives.

17.name: The Ringer
17.description: A criminal master of disguise nicknamed The Ringer is out for deadly revenge against a treacherous London lawyer who is under police protection.

18.name: Springfield Rifle
18.description: Major Lex Kearney becomes the North's first counterespionage agent as he tries to discover who's behind the theft of Union cavalry horses in Colorado during the Civil War.

19.name: Above and Beyond
19.description: Col. Paul Tibbetts piloted the plane that dropped the atomic bomb on Hiroshima in World War 2.

20.name: Viva Zapata!
20.description: The story of Mexican revolutionary Emiliano Zapata, who led a rebellion against the corrupt, oppressive dictatorship of president Porfirio Díaz in the early 20th century.

21.name: Umberto D.
21.description: An elderly man and his dog struggle to survive on his government pension in Rome.

22.name: Come Back, Little Sheba
22.description: An emotionally remote recovering alcoholic and his dowdy, unambitious wife face a personal crisis when they take in an attractive lodger.

23.name: Miss Robin Hood
23.description: Henry Wrigley (Richard Hearne) is happy writing stories for a children's' comic. Then he meets Miss Honey (Dame Margaret Rutherford), who encourages him to go into minor crime.

24.name: Folly to Be Wise
24.description: Newly arrived Army chaplin Captain Paris (Alastair Sim) attempts to book various acts for the entertainment of a troop of soldiers.

25.name: Monkey Business
25.description: A chemist finds his personal and professional life turned upside down when one of his chimpanzees finds the fountain of youth.

26.name: Ivanhoe
26.description: A knight seeks to free the captive King Richard and put him back on the throne.

27.name: Bend of the River
27.description: When a town boss confiscates homesteader's supplies after gold is discovered nearby, a tough cowboy risks his life to try and get it to them.

28.name: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
28.description: Writer Harry Street reflects on his life as he lies dying from an infection while on safari in the shadow of Mount Kilamanjaro.

29.name: The Cimarron Kid
29.description: Unjustly accused of robbing the train he was riding home, Bill Doolin re-joins his old gang, participates in other robberies and becomes a wanted outlaw.

30.name: Sudden Fear
30.description: After an ambitious actor insinuates himself into the life of a wealthy middle-aged playwright and marries her, he plots with his mistress to murder her.

31.name: Botany Bay
31.description: In 1787, American medical student Hugh Tallant and British convicts are sent from London to New South Wales on a ship commanded by the evil Captain Gilbert.

32.name: Kansas City Confidential
32.description: An ex-con trying to go straight is framed for a million dollar armored car robbery and must go to Mexico in order to unmask the real culprits.

33.name: Don't Bother to Knock
33.description: After being dumped by his girlfriend, an airline pilot pursues a babysitter in his hotel and gradually realizes she's dangerous.

34.name: The Story of Robin Hood and His Merrie Men
34.description: With King Richard away at the crusades, Prince John rules England with an iron fist and tasks the Sheriff of Nottingham with the collection of high taxes and the capture of outlaw Robin Hood.

35.name: Assignment - Paris
35.description: Cold war intrigue in France and Hungary.

36.name: The Importance of Being Earnest
36.description: When Algernon discovers that his friend, Ernest, has created a fictional brother for whenever he needs a reason to escape dull country life, Algernon poses as the brother, resulting in ever increasing confusion.

37.name: Retreat, Hell!
37.description: The saga of a battalion of U.S. Marines during the Korean War, starting with their training, landing at Inchon in 1950, advance into North Korea and their subsequent retreat back to the 38th parallel.

38.name: The Crimson Pirate
38.description: During the 1700s, pirate Captain Vallo seizes a British warship and gets involved in various money-making schemes involving Caribbean rebels led by El Libre, British envoy Baron Jose Gruda, and a beautiful courtesan named Consuelo.

39.name: Jeux interdits
39.description: A young French girl orphaned in a Nazi air attack is befriended by the son of a poor farmer, and together they try to come to terms with the realities of death.

40.name: Ochazuke no aji
40.description: A childless middle-aged couple faces a marital crisis.

41.name: Hans Christian Andersen
41.description: The opening scene of the movie describes it best: "Once upon a time there lived in Denmark a great storyteller named Hans Christian Andersen. This is not the story of his life, but a fairy tale about the great spinner of fairy tales."

42.name: Scaramouche
42.description: In France during the late 18th Century, a man sets out to avenge the death of his friend at the hands of a master swordsman.

43.name: Lo sceicco bianco
43.description: During a day in their honeymoon, a couple is separated by the city's lust and the desires it produces.

44.name: Son of Paleface
44.description: Junior Potter returns to claim his father's gold, which is nowhere to be found. "Mike" is the luscious head of a gang of thieves, and Roy Barton is the federal marshal hot on her trail.

45.name: My Cousin Rachel
45.description: A young man plots revenge against the woman he believes murdered his cousin, but his plans are shaken when he comes face to face with the enigmatic beauty.

46.name: Clash by Night
46.description: Mae Doyle comes back to her hometown a cynical woman. Her brother Joe fears that his love, fish cannery worker Peggy, may wind up like Mae. Mae marries Jerry and has a baby; she is happy but restless, drawn to Jerry's friend Earl.

47.name: The Narrow Margin
47.description: A woman planning to testify against the mob must be protected against their assassins on the train trip from Chicago to Los Angeles.

48.name: Against All Flags
48.description: Brian Hawke of the Royal Navy versus the pirates of Madagascar.

49.name: The Duel at Silver Creek
49.description: Marshal Tyrone and the Silver Kid form an uneasy alliance against a gang of claim jumpers.

50.name: The Star
50.description: A washed-up movie queen finds romance, but still desires a comeback.
